Package eu.acclimatize.unison.user

Class UserReadyEventListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.acclimatize.unison.user.UserReadyEventListener
  • @Component
public class UserReadyEventListener
extends Object
    An event listener that saves user information for an initial if there is no user information stored in the database once the application has been initialized at start time. The component uses the default.username and default.encoded properties if provided. Otherwise, initial user information requested if there is a console available.

      Creates an instance of UserReadyEventListener.

      void initialUser()
      If there are no users stored in the database and the default.username and default.password properties are set, they are used to add an initial user to the database.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserReadyEventListener

        public UserReadyEventListener​(UserRepository userRepository,
                              Logger logger,
                              Boolean consolePresent,
                              @Value("${default.username:#{null}}")
                              String defaultUserName,
                              @Value("${default.encoded:#{null}}")
                              String defaultEncoded,
                              Executor executor,
                              org.springframework.security.crypto.password.PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder)
        Creates an instance of UserReadyEventListener.
        Parameters:
        userRepository - The repository user credentials information is stored.
        logger - Used to log events when the user consoles is not present, such as in testing.
        consolePresent - Used to determine whether to request initial user data from a CredentialsRequester.
        defaultUserName - Assigned using the default.username property. If not null and no users stored, used in adding an initial user to the database.
        defaultEncoded - An encoded password assigned using the default.encoded property. Used in adding an initial user to the database if not null and no users stored.
        executor - Used to request user credentials on a separate thread.
        passwordEncoder - The encoder used to encrypt passwords.

    • Method Detail

      • initialUser

        @EventListener(org.springframework.boot.context.event.ApplicationReadyEvent.class)
public void initialUser()
        If there are no users stored in the database and the default.username and default.password properties are set, they are used to add an initial user to the database. Alternatively, if the properties are not set, the console will be used to request user information if it is available and the server is running in interactive mode.
